11212112.content:
Well, this sucked. You didn't even have the words to express how much it sucked. You had been eaten alive, gulped down by a gigantic undead woman. That sentence was easily the most unrealistic, unbelievable thought to cross your mind, but the situation you were in was so far outside your definition of normal you really didn't know what to do.

First off, your city (and the whole world, likely) had been caught up in an honest-to-God zombie apocalypse. Second, you had somehow been reduced to a fraction of your size, a living breathing human being only a little bigger than a toy army man. And thirdly, you had been swallowed whole by one of the zombie ladies prowling the city.

There was one bright side to your situation, however. The lady who's gut you were currently imprisoned in was, as mentioned earlier, stone-cold dead. Dead people, as a matter of fact, lost all of their bodily functions, both voluntary and involuntary when they died.

So, to reiterate, you were currently stuck in the slightly-overfilled stomach of a dead lady that had absolutely no stomach acid to speak of. After your initial discovery, you had been immensely relieved to find that you were not going to dissolve screaming in agony into a puddle of goo.

But now, your phone told you that several hours had passed since you'd been gulped down by your dead-head red-head captress. And after several hours wallowing in a slimy, squishy sac full of decomposing meat, you were almost willing to take the gastric juices of death than put up with this hell. And to further aggravate you, you had no idea just where the hell you were! The zombie you were inside was still alive (or at least whatever served as alive for them), and she had clearly moved on from the location she had nabbed you at. She could be anywhere inside the city, so even if you did somehow manage to get out of the stomach you had no way of knowing if you would emerge to safety and security, or another horde of zombies. And at your size you had quickly been proven that you weren't even able to outrun a single zombie.

Only one thing gave you a clue as to what might happen in the next several hours; the meat pile you were sitting on (urgh) was clearly in an advanced state of decay. You were no expert, but it seemed to have been about a week since this particular zombie lady had eaten. Figures, she had shitty luck in life, and she had shitty luck in death. Sucked for her.

So, both of you were hungry. You had only a few ways of escaping this hell on your own. If your gigantic necrotic captress was successful in taking down pray today, her stomach would likely be filled to the point that you'd have a chance at crawling out of her throat. On the flip-side, you could try and signal someone for help. It wouldn't be a conventional distress signal by any means, no, you'd be using your environment to your advantage.

The gas being produced by the rotting meat surrounding and piling up beneath you was steadily building in the undead woman's gut, and every several minutes you'd hear a loud, long *BWOOORPH* as the building gasses erupted out of the woman's mouth. She'd have a hard time creeping up on anyone, but if you could shift the meat inside of her (as disgusting as it was) you could likely make her stomach fill up with gas more quickly. The lady's intestines seemed to be absolutely plugged shut with rotting meat, clogged to the point of allowing nothing to pass through them, so if you could get some of that gas to flow back into the stomach the ensuing belches would likely alert every living being around the zombie to her presence. Just hope you didn't end up gassing yourself...

1542211132.content:
"Excuse?" Claire said stunned by the request of the little man. "Look, I see that you have no pockets in your pants and that your jacket is saturated with objects. I won't joke in your panties and in your mouth you could bite me by accident. So ... I'd rather go in your boots." the little man cleared to Claire as she outlined a dumbfounded face. "I understand your reasons, but you should keep in mind that I have been running from one place to another on this island in search of a way out and I don't wear socks you know? Besides ... I haven't showered since this started ... It won't be nice there ... "Claire replied. "Aaghhhh would have preferred you not to tell me damn it! Do you know how difficult it was to decide this?"
The little one expressed his disagreement. "I'm sorry," Claire said as she unfastened one of her boots. Although he was worried about the latter, the little man still kept his decision and as soon as Claire took off his boot he entered slowly. The smell was bad, but not so horrible. The worst was the sweat inside the shoes. By not wearing socks, the boot was soaked in sweat. The sweat was such that, being a leather boot, it looked like a swamp.
The boy did not want to experience that "swamp" first hand so he decided to stand at the base of the heel, so when Claire put his stinky foot he will not have to suffer under his sole. Unfortunately for him, Claire lifted his boot to put it on, and this caused the little man to walk completely face down in the center of the boot having a full test of Claire's sweat. It tasted sour and was very unpleasant, so in the middle of the panic he just turned upward and caught his breath. "Damn Claire! Warn before doing that!" the little one exclaimed furiously from inside the giant's boot while she continued with the process of putting on her shoes, now with a new involuntary insole. When the little man saw Claire's foot enter, he began to hyperventilate and in an attempt to stand up, he slipped with his sweat and fell on his bottom. To dodge Claire's toes, she decided to go to bed quickly, but this had sealed her place under her sole. Claire, meanwhile, was buckling her boot again. This time tighter than ever "It would be bad if he somehow fell off my boot, it would be best to adjust it to the maximum so that there are no openings."
When Claire finished she felt a pleasant sensation of pressure on her sole "wow, hey, are you small? I thought you would stand by my heel to avoid the plague, but think that you would put on as my template so I can feel if you are still inside of my boot and you didn't fall .... Well thought out! " Claire praised her tiny companion while she was boiling in rage, since because of her he was in this situation. "And although I hate to think you're suffering, I like the pressure you make against my sole, it's like a relaxing massage," Claire thought to herself as she went deep into a warm tropical island.

1542211222.content:
"Well I was an assistant researcher working on a, um, S virus that could"
"Nope" Claire interrupted, your heart flew into your throat as she let go of your leg and you plummeted towards her face below you. You only fell a short distance before your fall was abruptly stopped by Claire catching you with her hand again. "One last chance little guy, be very careful what you say next." Claire threatened, making sure you could see down her throat as much as possible while she talked. Your mind was racing, you couldn't tell her the truth or else Umbrella would definitely ensure your death. You made your choice, you just needed to lie more convincingly.
"I was, oh no." You didn't need to continue, you could tell from her wordless scowl that your titanic cellmate had already seen right through you. You opened your mouth to protest but all that came out was a scream as her hand let go and you plummeted into the waiting maw of Claire Redfield. Her mouth was wet, humid, and horrible. You didn't have time to take in the true terror of her mouth as you plummeted straight down the woman's throat. It was dark inside her, the muscles of her esophagus pulled you deeper and deeper. You could actually feel Claire quietly moaning as you traveled through her, eventually you reached her stomach with a wet plop. The stomach wasn't big but it felt large enough after the suffocating confines of Claire's throat. As you sat in her dark wet stomach you felt the vibrations of Claire patting her stomach, then you heard her voice.
"That was amazing, I wish I'd taken more time to taste you, I suppose that wonderful feeling of you squirming in there will have to be enough for now." You heard the giantess let out a satisfied sigh before she continued...

Raccoon City turned to be a nightmare for the citizens, but for you it turned to be the craziest thing you ever lived. Not only you were trapped at the STARS office with some Zombies trying to open the door, but you also shrunk ! From what you remembered, a virus has been unleashed in the whole city making people turning into Zombies, but it seems that there were another virus which affected your size.
.
You also remembered that you tried to escape some death walkers, and joined the STARS office in the purpose to find more informations about these virus. After all, some weeks before, Chris Redfield and Jill Valentinee tried to warn the RCPD about this and no one believed them. In fact they even were disgraced and disappeared after telling their story at Spencer's Mansion.

You were just a cop, waiting for a new recruit named Kennedy, and now you were at last happy for him that he never comes. But now you need help !

The door finally opened, and due to your new size you hoped that the female zombie which walked into the room won't be able to see you...But your hoped get crushed instantly as she looked down right at you !

" These things can probably smell my human odor ! " You groaned as you began to run.

The giant Zombie walked slowly, but it was still faster than you...as she cames closer and closer before you can hide under a desk...
